subject: Re: [junit] Use of @Before?
msgSnippet: Ride, You re mostly right.  A majority of what could be done in @Before methods can just as well be done in field initializers or constructors.  The caveat is
messageBody:
Ride,

You're mostly right. A majority of what could be done in @Before methods
can just as well be done in field initializers or constructors. The caveat
is if your @Before method could throw an exception: JUnit will run all the
@Afters after a failing @Before, but it can't do that if the object fails to
construct. So if your @Afters are globally important (releasing system
resources), do all risky things in @Befores. I usually generalize this to
having one @Before for each @After, although that's not strictly necessary.

David Saff
